items.label: 58d2f44b5457a3ac2fd557ef
items.name: Residential Energy Management Time-Of-Use (REMT) Three Phase
items.description: For residential service to single family residences or individual family apartments supplied through one meter, including incidental family use, on the appurtenant premises. This Rate Schedule (REMT) is not applicable to commercial type use on the premises such as chicken brooding and grain drying. Where a portion of the residence premises (not separately metered) is used for nonresidential purposes, the predominant use of the service, as determined by the Company, shall determine the Rate Schedule applicable to all service. Service is for the use of the customer and may not be shared and may not be resold to others. Not applicable to standby or supplementary service. Customers currently taking service under the Company's Optional Residential Time-of-Use Rate Schedule RT may terminate that service and begin service under this schedule provided they have completed twelve (12) continuous months of service under schedule RT.
items.basicinformationcomments:
Formula Rate Plan (FRP) and the Municipal Franchise Adjustment Rider (MFA) are adjustments included in the calculation of rates
by the utility but not included in the URDB due to how the two riders are calculated on other variable conditions.
items.energycomments:
Adjustments = ANO Decommissioning Cost Rider (NDCR) + Energy Cost Recovery Rider (ECR) + Energy Efficiency Cost Rate Rider (EECR). Rate per kWh = Base Rate + Formula Rate Plan (FRP). Monthly Rate = Base Monthly Rate * Formula Rate Plan.
+ Grand Gulf Rider (GGR) + Federal Litigation Consulting Fee Rider (FLCF) + Capacity Cost Recovery Rider (CCR)
+ Production Cost Allocation Rider (PCA)+ Capacity Acquisition Rider (CA)+ Storm Recovery Charges Rider (SRC)
+ Government Mandated Expenditure Surcharge Rider (GMES)+ MISO Rider (MISO)
